    Knot2.alignHandles()
    Aligns this knot's handles in the same direction while preserving their magnitude.
    Knot2
    Knot2.alignHandlesBackward()
    Aligns this knot's fore handle to its rear handle while preserving magnitude.
    Knot2
    Knot2.alignHandlesForward()
    Aligns this knot's rear handle to its fore handle while preserving magnitude.

    Knot2.Lerp.applyUnclamped(Knot2 origin, Knot2 dest, float step, Knot2 target)
    Eases between two knots by a step using the formula (1.0 - t) * a + t * b .

    Sets two knots from a segment of a cubic curve.

    Assumes that the previous knot's coordinate is set to the first anchor point.

    Knot2.fromSegCubicRefl(float xNextControl, float yNextControl, float xNextAnchor, float yNextAnchor, Knot2 prev, Knot2 next)
    Sets two knots from a segment of a cubic curve which reflect an existing segment.

    Assumes that the previous knot's coordinate is set to the first anchor point.
    static Knot2
    Knot2.fromSegCubicRefl(Vec2 nextControl, Vec2 nextAnchor, Knot2 prev, Knot2 next)
    Sets two knots from a segment of a cubic curve which reflect an existing segment.

    Knot2
    Knot2.mirrorHandles()
    Mirrors this knot's handles.
    Knot2
    Knot2.mirrorHandlesBackward()
    Sets the forward-facing handle to mirror the rear-facing handle: the fore will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the rear.
    Knot2
    Knot2.mirrorHandlesForward()
    Sets the rear-facing handle to mirror the forward-facing handle: the rear will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the fore.
    Knot2
    Knot2.relocate(Vec2 v)
    Relocates the knot to a new location while maintaining the relationship between the central coordinate and its two handles.
    Knot2
    Knot2.reverse()
    Reverses the knot's direction by swapping the fore- and rear-handles.
